basic.description: This course utilizes Matlab and a programming language (C/Fortran). The course is a continuation of STA 4102 in computational techniques for linear and non-linear statistics. The course also explores topics such as statistical image understanding, elements of pattern theory, simulated annealing, Metropolis-Hastings algorithm, and Gibbs sampling.
basic.subject: STA
basic.title: Computational Methods in Statistics II

extra.enrollment_requirement: For details on the requisites (pre/co/miscellaneous) for this class, please check the course listings under the appropriate departments & programs sections of the most current and relevant (Undergraduate/Graduate) edition of the General Bulletin
